DS3: A System-Level Domain-Specific System-on-ChipSimulationFramework
processing_element.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 '''!
2 @brief This file contains the process elements and their attributes.
3 '''
4 import simpy
5 import copy
6 
7 import common # The common parameters used in DASH-Sim are defined in common_parameters.py
8 import DTPM_power_models
9 import DASH_Sim_utils
10 import DTPM_policies
11 
12 class PE:
13  '''!
14  A processing element (PE) is the basic resource that defines the simpy processes.
15  '''
16  def __init__(self, env, type, name, ID, cluster_ID, capacity):
17  '''!
18  @param env: Pointer to the current simulation environment
19  @param type: Type of the PE (e.g., BIG, LTL, ACC, MEM, etc.)
20  @param name: Name of the current processing element
21  @param ID: ID of the current processing element
22  @param cluster_ID: ID of the cluster to which this PE belongs
23  @param capacity: Number tasks that a resource can run simultaneously
24  '''
25  self.env = env
26  self.type = type
27  self.name = name
28  self.ID = ID
29  self.capacity = capacity # Current capacity of the PE (depends on the number of active cores)
30  self.total_capacity = capacity # Total capacity of the PE
31  self.cluster_ID = cluster_ID
32 
33  self.enabled = True # Indicate if the PE is ON
34  self.utilization = 0 # Describes how much one PE is utilized
35  self.utilization_list = [] # List containing the PE utilization for each sample inside a snippet
36  self.current_power_active_core = 0 # Indicate the current power for the active cores (dynamic + static)
37  self.current_leakage_core = 0 # Indicate the current leakage power
38  self.snippet_energy = 0 # Indicate the energy consumption of the current snippet
39  self.total_energy = 0 # Indicate the total energy consumed by the given PE
40 
41  self.Cdyn_alpha = 0 # Variable that stores the dynamic capacitance * switching activity for each PE
42 
43  self.queue = [] # List of currently running task on a PE
44  self.available_time = 0 # Estimated available time of the PE
45  self.available_time_list = [0]*self.capacity # Estimated available time for each core os the PE
46  self.idle = True # The variable indicates whether the PE is active or not
47  self.blocking = 0 # Duration that a PE is busy when some other tasks are ready to execute
48  self.active = 0 # Total active time for a PE while executing a workload
49 
50  self.info = [] # List to record all the events happened on a PE
51  self.process = simpy.Resource(env, capacity=self.capacity)
52 
53  if (common.DEBUG_CONFIG):
54  print('[D] Constructed PE-%d with name %s' %(ID,name))
55 
56  # Start the "run" process for this PE
57  def run(self, sim_manager, task, resource, DVFS_module):
58  '''!
59  Run this PE to execute a given task.
60  The execution time is retrieved from resource_matrix and task name.
61  @param sim_manager: Simulation environment object (DASH_Sim_core)
62  @param task: Task to be executed
63  @param resource: Resource object for this PE
64  @param DVFS_module: DVFS module object
65  '''
66  try:
67  with self.process.request() as req: # Requesting the resource for the task
68  yield req
69 
70  if common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[self.cluster_ID].current_frequency == 0: # Initialize the frequency if it was not set yet
71  # Depending on the DVFS policy on this PE, set the initial frequency and voltage accordingly
72  if common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[self.cluster_ID].DVFS != 'none' or len(common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[self.cluster_ID].OPP) != 0:
73  DTPM_policies.initialize_frequency(common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[self.cluster_ID])
74 
75  DASH_Sim_utils.trace_frequency(self.env.now)
76 
77  self.idle = False # Since the PE starts execution of a task, it is not idle anymore
78  common.TaskQueues.running.list.append(task) # Since the execution started for the task we should add it to the running queue
79  task.start_time = self.env.now # When a resource starts executing the task, record it as the start time
80 
81  # if this is the leading task of this job, increment the injection counter
82  if ((task.head == True) and
83  (self.env.now >= common.warmup_period)):
84  common.results.injected_jobs += 1
85  if (common.DEBUG_JOB):
86  print('[D] Time %d: Total injected jobs becomes: %d'
87  %(self.env.now, common.results.injected_jobs))
88 
89  # Store the injected job for validation
90  if (common.simulation_mode == 'validation'):
91  common.Validation.injected_jobs.append(task.jobID)
92  # end of if ( (next_task.head == True) and ...
93 
94  if (common.DEBUG_JOB):
95  print('[D] Time %d: Task %s execution is started with frequency %d by PE-%d %s'
96  % (self.env.now, task.ID, common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[self.cluster_ID].current_frequency, self.ID, self.name))
97 
98  # Retrieve the execution time and power consumption from the model
99  task_runtime_max_freq, randomization_factor = DTPM_power_models.get_execution_time_max_frequency(task, resource) # Get the run time and power consumption
100 
101  dynamic_energy = 0
102  static_energy = 0
103  task_complete = False
104  task_elapsed_time = task.task_elapsed_time_max_freq
105  while task_complete is False:
106  # The predicted time takes into account the current frequency and subtracts the time that the task already executed
107  predicted_exec_time = (task_runtime_max_freq - task_elapsed_time) + (task_runtime_max_freq - task_elapsed_time) * DTPM_power_models.compute_DVFS_performance_slowdown(common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[self.cluster_ID])
108  window_remaining_time = common.sampling_rate - self.env.now % common.sampling_rate
109  # Test if the task finished before the next sampling period
110  if predicted_exec_time - window_remaining_time > 0:
111  # Run until the next sampling timestamp
112  simulation_step = window_remaining_time
113  slowdown = DTPM_power_models.compute_DVFS_performance_slowdown(common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[self.cluster_ID]) + 1
114  task_elapsed_time += simulation_step / slowdown
115  else:
116  # Run until the task ends
117  simulation_step = predicted_exec_time
118  task_complete = True
119 
120  # Compute the static energy
121  current_leakage = DTPM_power_models.compute_static_power_dissipation(self.cluster_ID)
122  static_energy += current_leakage * simulation_step * 1e-6
123 
124  max_power_consumption, freq_threshold = DTPM_power_models.get_max_power_consumption(common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[self.cluster_ID], sim_manager.PEs) # of this task on this resource running at max frequency
125 
126  # Based on the total power consumption and the leakage, get the dynamic power
127  if max_power_consumption > 0:
128  dynamic_power_cluster = max_power_consumption - current_leakage * len(common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[self.cluster_ID].power_profile[freq_threshold])
129  # After obtaining the dynamic power for the cluster, divide it by the number of cores being used to get the power per core
130  dynamic_power_max_freq_core = dynamic_power_cluster / DASH_Sim_utils.get_num_tasks_being_executed(common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[self.cluster_ID], sim_manager.PEs)
131  else:
132  dynamic_power_max_freq_core = 0
133 
134  # Compute the capacitance and alpha based on the dynamic power
135  self.Cdyn_alpha = DTPM_power_models.compute_Cdyn_and_alpha(resource, dynamic_power_max_freq_core, freq_threshold)
136 
137  # Compute the dynamic energy
138  dynamic_power = DTPM_power_models.compute_dynamic_power_dissipation(common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[self.cluster_ID].current_frequency,
139  common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[self.cluster_ID].current_voltage,
140  self.Cdyn_alpha)
141  dynamic_energy += dynamic_power * simulation_step * 1e-6
142 
143  # Scale the power based on the number of active cores
144  common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[self.cluster_ID].current_power_cluster = dynamic_power * DASH_Sim_utils.get_num_tasks_being_executed(common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[self.cluster_ID], sim_manager.PEs) + \
145  current_leakage * common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[self.cluster_ID].num_active_cores
146  self.current_leakage_core = current_leakage
147  self.current_power_active_core = dynamic_power + current_leakage
148 
149  if (common.simulation_mode == "performance" and self.env.now >= common.warmup_period) or common.simulation_mode == "validation":
150  energy_sample = (dynamic_power + current_leakage) * simulation_step * 1e-6
151  self.snippet_energy += energy_sample
152  self.total_energy += energy_sample
153  common.results.cumulative_energy_consumption += energy_sample
154 
155  yield self.env.timeout(simulation_step)
156  task.task_elapsed_time_max_freq = task_elapsed_time
157  # At each sample:
158  if self.env.now % common.sampling_rate == 0:
159  # Case 1: If the task is not complete, evaluate this PE at this moment
160  if task_complete is False:
161  DVFS_module.evaluate_PE(resource, self, self.env.now)
162 
163  task.finish_time = int(self.env.now)
164 
165  # As the task finished its execution, reset the task time
166  task.task_elapsed_time_max_freq = 0
167 
168  if (common.DEBUG_JOB):
169  print('[D] Time %d: Task %s execution is finished by PE-%d %s'
170  % (self.env.now, task.ID, self.ID, self.name))
171 
172  task_time = task.finish_time - task.start_time
173  self.idle = True
174 
175  if task.finish_time > common.warmup_period:
176  if task.start_time <= common.warmup_period:
177  self.active += (task.finish_time - common.warmup_period)
178  else:
179  self.active += task_time
180 
181  # If there are no OPPs in the model, use the measured power consumption from the model
182  if len(common.ClusterManager.cluster_list[self.cluster_ID].OPP) == 0:
183  total_energy_task = dynamic_power_max_freq_core * task_time * 1e-6
184  else:
185  total_energy_task = dynamic_energy + static_energy
186 
187  if (task.tail):
188  common.results.job_counter -= 1
189 
190  if (common.simulation_mode == 'performance'):
191  sim_manager.update_completed_queue()
192 
193  if (self.env.now >= common.warmup_period):
194  common.results.execution_time = self.env.now
195  common.results.completed_jobs += 1
196 
197  # Interrupts the timeout of job generator if the inject_jobs_ASAP flag is active
198  if sim_manager.job_gen.generate_job and common.inject_jobs_ASAP:
199  sim_manager.job_gen.action.interrupt()
200 
201  for completed in common.TaskQueues.completed.list:
202  if ((completed.head == True) and
203  (completed.jobID == task.jobID)):
204  common.results.cumulative_exe_time += (self.env.now - completed.job_start)
205 
206  if (common.DEBUG_JOB):
207  print('[D] Time %d: Job %d is completed' %(self.env.now, task.jobID+1))
208  #print('[D] total completed jobs becomes: %d' %(common.results.completed_jobs))
209  #print('[D] Cumulative execution time: %f' %(common.results.cumulative_exe_time))
210 
211  # Store the completed job for validation
212  if (common.simulation_mode == 'validation'):
213  common.Validation.completed_jobs.append(task.jobID)
214  # end of if ((task.tail) and ...
215 
216  if (common.INFO_SIM):
217  print('[I] Time %d: Task %s is finished by PE-%d %s with %.2f us and energy consumption %.2f J'
218  % (self.env.now, task.ID, self.ID, self.name, round(task_time,2), round(total_energy_task,2)) )
219  DASH_Sim_utils.trace_tasks(task, self, task_time, total_energy_task)
220  #for i, executable_task in enumerate(common.TaskQueues.executable.list):
221  # print('Task %d can be executed on PE-%d after time %d'%(executable_task.ID, executable_task.PE_ID, executable_task.time_stamp))
222 
223  # Retrieve the energy consumption for the task
224  # that the PE just finished processing
225  common.results.energy_consumption += total_energy_task
226 
227  # Since the current task is processed, it should be removed
228  # from the outstanding task queue
229  sim_manager.update_ready_queue(task)
230 
231  # Case 2: Evaluate the PE after the queues are updated
232  if self.env.now % common.sampling_rate == 0:
233  DVFS_module.evaluate_PE(resource, self, self.env.now)
234 
235  if (task.tail) and (self.env.now >= common.warmup_period) and (common.results.completed_jobs % common.snippet_size == 0):
236 
237  # Reset energy of the snippet
238  for PE in sim_manager.PEs:
239  PE.snippet_energy = 0
240 
241  common.snippet_start_time = self.env.now
242  common.snippet_initial_temp = copy.deepcopy(common.current_temperature_vector)
243 
244  common.snippet_throttle = -1
245  for cluster in common.ClusterManager.cluster_list:
246  cluster.snippet_power_list = []
247  common.snippet_temp_list = []
248  common.snippet_ID_exec += 1
249  if common.job_list != []:
250  if common.snippet_ID_exec < common.max_num_jobs / common.snippet_size:
251  common.current_job_list = common.job_list[common.snippet_ID_exec]
252 
253  # Ends the simulation if all jobs are executed (if inject_fixed_num_jobs is enabled)
254  if common.results.completed_jobs == common.max_num_jobs:
255  #common.simulation_length = self.env.now
256  sim_manager.sim_done.succeed()
257 
258  # end of with self.process.request() as req:
259 
260  except simpy.Interrupt:
261  print('Expect an interrupt at %s' % (self.env.now))
262  # end of def run(self, sim_manager, task, resource):
263 
264
